campaign_submissions.rejected_justification: Aca va la justificacion de porque se decidio reporbar el reporte

campaign_content.name: What's the product?
campaign_content.description:
The Innovatio Founder it's the first crowdfunding reward based platform on the Cardano's blockchain.


Innovatio Founder is a dynamic B2C crowdfunding platform that empowers diverse products, communities, and projects to launch their own campaigns and secure the funding needed to bring their ideas to life. Currently, only projects seeking to raise funds in ADA, the native currency of the Cardano blockchain, will be accepted, as this DApp is executed on Cardano.

Therefore, any project, community, brand, or organization can contact the Innovatio team to develop their crowdfunding campaign alongside a professional team specializing in business, product, marketing, and development. The Innovatio team will assist with the drafting and strategy of your crowdfunding campaign to help you reach your funding goal. If you don't have your utility token developed yet, the Innovatio team can help you determine the tokenomics, mint it, and deploy it on the network to start your campaign. Thanks to this platform, launching crowdfunding campaigns on Cardano is just a step away. What are you waiting for?

campaign_content.name: What's your value?
campaign_content.description:
Crowdfunding Marketplace B2C with funds decentralized and desintermediated management.



The distinguishing feature of Innovatio Founder lies in the disintermediation of fund management and the control over campaign development once the fundraising goal is achieved. While funds are securely stored in a fully decentralized smart contract, the Innovatio team of professionals will review campaign proposals to ensure they are well-developed before they are accepted into the marketplace for fundraising.

Additionally, the Innovatio team will monitor the progress of campaigns after they reach their funding goal to ensure that milestones are being met. If a campaign fails to meet its milestones, the team will deem the proposal unsuccessful and initiate the refund process for investors.

campaign_content.name: How it wokrs?
campaign_content.description:
Fundraising goal, milestones & periodic results.



To explain how the campaign flow works, we'll use an example where the campaign "Cardano’s Workshops in LATAM" launched a crowdfunding campaign aiming to raise $25,000 by selling 50 digital tickets to this workshop. This will allow 50 developers from the community to be trained by the best professionals in the ecosystem. To achieve this, the project developed a detailed explanation and determined that it could be delivered in 3 milestones of 1 month each.


Once they reach the funding goal, they will have 3 months to complete the project and deliver the 50 digital tickets (utility tokens) to the developers so they can attend the Digital Workshop. Following the example, the first milestone is focused on determining the date and confirming the mentors from Cardano, promising at least 3 top companies in smart-contract development on Cardano. The percentage of funds established in the first milestone is released, and the project will have to present the previously set objectives and deliverables.


If the Innovatio team, upon reviewing these results, determines that the milestone is met, they will mark it as satisfied and activate the distribution for the second milestone, and so on. If this first milestone is not satisfactory, the Innovatio team will cancel the campaign, and the Re-fund protocol will be activated for the campaign investors, who will recover the proportional part of their investment and the pending funds for distribution.

campaigns.title: Representacion de la campaña creada
campaigns.description: Este card representa la campaign que fue creada, pero todavia no fue subida a la base de datos, por lo que no deberia renderizarse ni en el homepage, ni en la pagina de protocol managers. Solo en la de la campaña para que pueda editarlo

campaigns.title: Campaña que ya fue submitteada con la data
campaigns.description: Representacion de la campaña que fue ya actualizada y se empezaron a cargar la informacion del project detail, del roadmap, del team, del tokenomics y del FAQ --- Solo debe renderizarse en la pagina de managment de los usuarios que crearon la campaña (view campaign) y en la del protocol team donde se tiene que ver el boton de view campaign y de manage campain

campaigns.title: Campaña que fue rechazada
campaigns.description: Campaña que fue rechazada por los protocol managers, por lo que no deberia renderizarse en el homepage, en la de los members se renderiza en conjunto al boton de view report que los redirecciona a la pagina /campaign?id=[id], en el protocol team se les ve el boton de view campaign y de edit campaign

campaigns.title: Campañana que fue aprobada
campaigns.description: Campañana que fue aprobada, pero todavia no se generaron los contratos --- se renderiza en la pagina de managers (view campaign) y del protocol team (view campaing y create campaign contracts)

campaigns.title: Campaña con el contrato creado
campaigns.description: Los contratos fueron creados para la campaña, en manager se puede ver el view-campaing /// en porotcol tem se deeberia poder ve view campaign y publish campaign contracts --- el label es Created

campaigns.title: Campaña con el contrato publicado
campaigns.description: Los contratos fueron publicados. El Protocolo deberá inicializar los contratos. Se creará el Datum de la Campaña. // en el home no se renderiza, el label que se marca es de deploy, los managers ven el boton de view campaign y el protocol tem view campaign y intilize campaign contracts (tx)

campaigns.title: Campana cn el contrato started
campaigns.description: Los contratos fueron iniciados. El Protocolo o Managers deberán iniciar la campaña cuando hayan creado las UTxOs de Fondos y haya dejado los tokens necesarios a la venta. en el dash de protocol y de manager se ve view campaign y launch campaign (tx), el label es Ready

campaigns.title: Countdown
campaigns.description: La campaña fue iniciada pero la fecha de comienzo aún no llega. el label es un countdown hasta la fecha que sale a la venta los tokens, se debe renderizar en todas las paginas

campaigns.title: Fundraising activado, la fecha de inicio ya paso, se encuentra vendiendo tokens,
campaigns.description: Fundraising activado, la fecha de inicio ya paso, se encuentra vendiendo tokens

campaigns.title: Campaña activa --- todavia no vencio la fecha para enviar reportes para los managers

milestone_status.name: Bit
milestone_status.description:
The first milestone corresponds to the official launch of the product development. Therefore, this first Milestone aims to achieve the development of the mock-up and the integration of the smart contracts.


Deliverables:

  1. Figma Mockup in react, 100% functional in the UI with minimal complications with the backend
  2. Comprehensive document outlining the tech, frameworks, and architectures used for MVP development.
  3. Payment to all team members, fulfilling all salaries.

milestone_status.name: in_progress
milestone_status.description:
The second milestone is focused on completing the infrastructure and integration of the smart contracts and all backend of the application in general.


  1. Application architectures and its backend.
  2. Operation and relationship of the smart contracts
  3. Testing video demonstrating the functionality of the backend and the main smart contracts.

milestone_status.name: completed
milestone_status.description:
The third and final milestone correspond to launching the functional application into pre-production and condcting a demostration of the entire UX, smart contracts and backend operations.



  1. Testing video demonstrating the functionality of the backend and the main smart contracts.
  2. App archi

campaigns.title: Campaña activa --- estamos en el medio de los milestones asi que la config depende de los estados de los milestones
campaigns.description: Campaña activa --- el manager ya envio el reporte y todavia no recibio un feedback.
